datasources.name: Kubernetes
datasources.description: Logz.io Uses OpenTelemetry and Fluentd with Helm charts to deploy and monitor Kubernetes architecture

params.name: envID
params.label: Environment Name
params.description: The name for your environments identifier, to easily identify the telemetry data for each environment.
params.hint: By typing an environment name, the name will be added as a label to the telemetry data of your environment. Default value will be used if empty.

params.name: isTaint
params.label: Taints and Tolerations
params.description: Taints allow a node to repel a series of pods. Tolerations are applied to pods and allow them to schedule onto nodes with matching taints. Enable to force deployment on all pods.
params.hint: By checking this option the Logz.io Telemetry Collector will be deployed on all nodes.

telemetries.hint: Switch the toggle on if you want Logzio Telemetry Collector to collect logs from your Kubernetes cluster components and applications pods
Switch the toggle on if you want Logz.io Telemetry Collector to collect metrics from your Kubernetes cluster, nodes and pods

params.name: isWindows
params.label: Using Windows nodes
params.hint: Check this box if any of your Kubernetes pods are running on Windows nodes. As part of the installation process, you will need to provide the root user credentials to those Windows instances

telemetries.hint: Switch the toggle on if you want Logz.io Telemetry Collector to collect traces from your instrumented applications in the Kubernetes environment
